TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit MediaPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission
Public NotInheritable Class MediaPermission Inherits CodeAccessPermission Implements IUnrestrictedPermission
public ref class MediaPermission sealed : System::Security::CodeAccessPermission, System::Security::Permissions::IUnrestrictedPermission
type MediaPermission = class inherit CodeAccessPermission interface IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: The describes a set of security permissions that controls the ability for audio, image, and video media to work in a partial-trust Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This permission uses the values of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAudio>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionImage>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo> enumerations.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying the audio permission level.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default values for image and video permissions are <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionImage.SafeImage> and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo.SafeVideo>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission> with a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAudio> value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying a permission state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If `state` is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>, all media types are granted full permission to play or display with no restrictions. If `state` is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.None>, all media types are restricted from playing or displaying.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission> with a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> value.

Public Overrides Function Copy () As IPermission

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of a permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Intersect (target As IPermission) As IPermission

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the state that they both describe in common. Only a demand that passes both original permissions will be valid for the intersected permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed
Public Overrides Function IsSubsetOf (target As IPermission) As Boolean

Docs.param: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission. For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\.
If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed
abstract member IsUnrestricted : unit -> bool override this.IsUnrestricted : unit -> bool

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.
Docs.returns: if the audio, image, and video permissions are all unrestricted; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The return value is `true` when the media permission values are <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAudio.AllAudio>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionImage.AllImage>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo.SafeVideo>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to determine whether the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission> is unrestricted.

Public Overrides Function Union (target As IPermission) As IPermission

Docs.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
